title: Art investment firms wound up after taking £1m from the vulnerable and elderly
text:
Two companies who took £1m from “vulnerable and elderly” people after offering them the chance to invest in works by artists such as Picasso and Salvador Dali have been wound up.

Gem Tobin, based in Warrington, Cheshire, and Dionysus Design Services of York, took almost £1m from customers telling them the money was being invested in valuable works of art.

However investigators found no evidence the money had been used to invest in artworks. Gem Tobin received £700,000 from investors while Dionysus Design received £200,000.

The Insolvency Service discovered the £1m art investment scheme appeared to have been operated from Spain or Morocco.
